author: ARandomLegoFan
title: A very square diving scooter
review:
Please note that I will only review the set and not the magazine.

Part 1: The diving scooter:

The diving scooter has a severe lack of curves and has alot of right angles. It has a handle for the figure to ride but is placed to far up front, so it will be a pain to get the figure on. The front has two massive round lights (or cameras) which is strange because as far as I'm aware diving scooters don't have giant round lights. The side has part of the propellers which is odd because real diving scooters just have one big propeller in the back. The rear has a red 1x2 rounded plate which must represent something. My best guess is that it's a screen which is why those lights could be cameras but there normally not massive like what's on the set and part of the tiny propellers.

Part 2: The figure and crab:

The crab is your typical Lego crab except for the fact that this crab can apparently breathe underwater because he is in a diving set. The diver is named Eddie Eager because it's a Lego magazine, so they give the characters names for the story. Also on some pages he's called Eagar, but his true name is Eager because his employment contract says so (yes the magazine does include his employment contract this wasn't a joke). He has red flippers, gunmetal grey legs, gunmetal grey torso with typical scuba printing, a dual face print with one terrified face and a smile and last but least is his helmet, it's a red motorbike helmet with a light blue snorkel piece.

Pros: comes with a comic.

Cons: crabs don't belong in the ocean, diving scooter only vaguely resembles real ones and figure is hard to fit on.
